newsitem.title: GERMANY: German helicopters fly out 100 foreigners.
newsitem.headline: German helicopters fly out 100 foreigners.

text.p: German military helicopters have safely flown about 100 Germans and other foreigners out of Albania, the foreign ministry said on Friday.
Diplomatic sources in Tirana said six helicopters had flown into the country to pick up the group because road transport was deemed too dangerous.
The spokesman did not say where the helicopters had landed.
Foreign Minister Klaus Kinkel and Defence Minister Volker Ruehe would announce more details at a news conference in about one hour, he said.
Earlier on Friday, German officials said there were 12 or 13 Germans still in Tirana as well as about 50 foreigners under Bonn's consular protection.
These were mostly Hungarians and Austrians, a foreign ministry spokesman said, and there were also a few Japanese and Belgians in the group.
